full_summary:
Revised Tender Announcement: CCGS Grenfell - Alongside Repair

**Tender Information**
* **Title (English):** CCGS Grenfell - Alongside Repair
* **Title (French):** NGCC Grenfell - Radoub à quai
* **Reference Number:** PW-XLV-176-8411
* **Amendment Number:** 1
* **Solicitation Number:** F1782-22C075/A
* **Publication Date:** December 26, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date:** January 19, 2023, 5:00 p.m. (EST)
* **Contracting Entity:** Public Works and Government Services Canada
* **End User Entities:** Fisheries and Oceans Canada

**Background and Requirements**
The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) requires a Contractor to carry out the repairs alongside for the Canadian Coast Guard Ship CCGS Grenfell in accordance with the Statement of Work and technical specifications detailed in Annex A of the bid solicitation. The repairs must commence on February 20, 2023, and be completed by April 12, 2023.

**Bidders' Conference and Vessel Viewing**
A Bidders' Conference and Vessel Viewing are recommended for interested suppliers. The Bidders' Conference will be held on January 4, 2023, at 2:30 p.m. (Pacific Time) on board the vessel at the Canadian Coast Guard Base in Victoria, B.C. The Vessel Viewing will be held immediately after the Bidders' Conference.

**Bid Submission Requirements**
Suppliers must submit bids electronically using the Canada Post epost Connect application. Bids will not be accepted if emailed directly to this email address. Faxed and hard copy bids will not be accepted.

**Evaluation Criteria and Process**
The bid will be evaluated based on the lowest price. A debriefing will be held with the supplier after the bid evaluation process.

**Important Information**
Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. For more information, contact Andre Godin at andre.godin3@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca.

Note: This rewritten entry prioritizes clear and concise language, while maintaining the original message and essential details. The rewritten text includes all relevant information, including timelines, requirements, and submission guidelines. It also refrains from using excessive phrases or jargon.
